info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 9 at 5:23PM CDT until July 9 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Austin/San Antonio TX
info.description:
* WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of south central Texas, including the following county, Llano.
* WHEN...Until 900 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. Water over roadways.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 523 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Kingsland, Llano, Gainesville, Buchanan Lake Village, Castell, Oxford, Stolz, Lone Grove, Valley Spring, Baby Head, Prairie Mountain, Enchanted Rock State Natural Area, Bluffton, Field Creek and Tow. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CDT THIS EVENING
